instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No wifi
threads.message:
Hello.

This macbook came in for speaker connector replacement, (they ripped the old one) , after replacing it I noticed that the macbook is not detecting the wireless card. 

I have tried with another flex cable (not with other card) and same issue.

Any help?

NOTE: I do see the icon of the wifi but when clicking I do not see any wireless network

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No wifi
threads.message:
Discard a software issue first.
Do PRAM reset and test the machine with another macOS.

Wifi hardware is correctly detected in System report?
You may have a problem with antenna cables.
Connect the antennas from a spare LCD assembly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No wifi
threads.message:
I checked all you mentioned and same problem, proceeded to check board and noticed that <CAPACITOR>C3531</CAPACITOR> was ripped from board. Replaced it and now the wifi is working. 

Thanks
